Specific Details: A general discussion took place regarding the recent UK referendum and subsequent decision to exit the European Union. Discussion focused on risks, contingencies, impact to Irish trade and economy. Overview of Intel's operations in Ireland and history of development were discussed align with investment in education and Irish economic stability and growth.
DPOs Lobbied: Michael McGrath|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas::Niall Collins|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas
Subject Matter: A general discussion took place regarding the recent UK referendum and subsequent decision to exit the European Union. Discussion focused on risks, contingencies, impact to Irish trade and economy. Overview of Intel's operations in Ireland and history of development were discussed align with investment in education and Irish economic stability and growth.
Intended Results: Desired result was to have broad discussion on matters relevant to ongoing business operations in Ireland, including a specific focus on the topic of UK exit from the European Union, with a view to being well informed on general matters of economic significance.
Lobbying Activities: Meeting took place at Leinster House on November 30th 2016.|Meeting|1
Person primarily responsible for lobbyin: Eamonn Sinnott, Intel Ireland General Manager
